Function Documentation

BOOL ARTransform3DEqualsWithAccuracy ( ARTransform3D  a,
ARTransform3D  b,
CGFloat  accuracy 
)

Compares matrices a and b by element. Returns YES if every element of a and b differ at most the specified accuracy.

Parameters:
a first matrix to compare
b second matrix to compare
accuracy the maximal allowed difference between two element values to be considered equal.
Returns:
YES if all elements of the matrices are less than or equal to the specified accuracy.
ARPoint3D ARTransform3DHomogeneousVectorMatrixMultiply ( ARPoint3D  a,
ARTransform3D  b 
)

Multiplies a column vector by a matrix.

Since vector-matrix multiplication needs the vector to consist of four elements, the fourth element is assumed to be 1. In a 3D transformation matrix, this means that the matrix' translation is applied on the output vector.

Parameters:
a column vector
b matrix
Returns:
vector * matrix
ARTransform3D ARTransform3DLookAt ( ARPoint3D  origin,
ARPoint3D  target,
ARPoint3D  upDirection,
ARPoint3D  alternativeUpDirection 
)

Construct an orthogonal transformation matrix A with a translation given by origin and oriented so that it faces the target in the direction of the z axis. The upDirection determines the roll (rotation around the z axis) of A.

This function is equivalent to ARTransform3DLookAtRelative(origin, target - origin, upDirection, alternativeUpDirection)

Parameters:
origin the location of the object
target the location the object should look at. May not be equal to origin.
upDirection a vector pointing upwards, to determine the roll of the object. Its length does not matter.
alternativeUpDirection a vector to determine the roll of the object if the targetDirection and upDirection are parallel. Its length does not matter. If this vector is zero or parallel to upDirection, the resulting matrix may contain NAN values if the targetDirection and upDirection are parallel.
Returns:
the matrix that was constructed
ARTransform3D ARTransform3DLookAtRelative ( ARPoint3D  origin,
ARPoint3D  targetDirection,
ARPoint3D  upDirection,
ARPoint3D  alternativeUpDirection 
)

Construct an orthogonal transformation matrix A with a translation given by origin and oriented so that it faces the target in the direction of the z axis. The upDirection determines the roll (rotation around the z axis) of A.

Parameters:
origin the location of the object
targetDirection a vector pointing in the direction of the target. May not be zero.
upDirection a vector pointing upwards, to determine the roll of the object. Its length does not matter.
alternativeUpDirection a vector to determine the roll of the object if the targetDirection and upDirection are parallel. Its length does not matter. If this vector is zero or parallel to upDirection, the resulting matrix may contain NAN values if the targetDirection and upDirection are parallel.
Returns:
the matrix that was constructed
ARTransform3D ARTransform3DMakeFromAxes ( ARPoint3D  xAxis,
ARPoint3D  yAxis,
ARPoint3D  zAxis 
)

Construct a transformation matrix given its x, y, and z axes, with no translation (0,0,0).

Parameters:
xAxis the values to be copied to the first row of the matrix.
yAxis the values to be copied to the second row of the matrix.
zAxis the values to be copied to the third row of the matrix.
translation the values to be copied to the fourth row of the matrix.
Returns:
the matrix that was constructed
ARTransform3D ARTransform3DMakeFromAxesAndTranslation ( ARPoint3D  xAxis,
ARPoint3D  yAxis,
ARPoint3D  zAxis,
ARPoint3D  translation 
)

Constructs a transformation matrix given its x, y, and z axes and translation:

TODO: What happens to the layout of the following when documentation is generated? [ xAxis.x, xAxis.y, xAxis.z, 0] [ yAxis.x, yAxis.y, yAxis.z, 0] [ zAxis.x, zAxis.y, zAxis.z, 0] [ trans.x, trans.y, trans.z, 1]

This function directly copies the input vectors; it does not normalize or orthagonalize the axes.

Parameters:
xAxis the values to be copied to the first row of the matrix.
yAxis the values to be copied to the second row of the matrix.
zAxis the values to be copied to the third row of the matrix.
translation the values to be copied to the fourth row of the matrix.
Returns:
the matrix that was constructed
ARPoint3D ARTransform3DNonhomogeneousVectorMatrixMultiply ( ARPoint3D  a,
ARTransform3D  b 
)

Multiplies a column vector by a matrix.

Since vector-matrix multiplication needs the vector to consist of four elements, the fourth element is assumed to be 0. In a 3D transformation matrix, this means that the matrix' translation is ignored.

Parameters:
a column vector
b matrix
Returns:
vector * matrix
ARTransform3D ARTransform3DTranspose ( ARTransform3D  transform  ) 

Transposes the matrix, changing rows into columns and vice-versa. For an orthogonal matrix, the result is equivalent to inversing the matrix.

Parameters:
transform the matrix to transform.
Returns:
the transformed matrix
